questions.summary_text: What health management/care navigation apps help with health needs and actions?
Is health information for self/loved ones easily accessible in one location? Benefits/obstacles?
Are you aware of useful health management, care navigation, or PHR apps for Medicare beneficiaries?
What features are missing from current apps or what apps should exist? What can CMS uniquely offer?
How can CMS encourage patient/caregiver interest in digital health products? CMS role in review/approval? Changes for data access?
What features are most important for accessibility and ease of use of digital health products for Medicare beneficiaries?
How best to collect real-world data on digital health products' impact on outcomes and costs post-market release?
What health data is readily available and valuable? What is valuable but hard to access? Other valuable data sources?
What additional CMS data for Blue Button 2.0 API to enable useful products? Difficulties? Suggestions for API?
How is TEFCA advancing patient access? Examples? Suggested changes? Impactful use cases? Useful standards?
How are HIEs advancing patient access? Data value/accuracy? Suggested changes? High-performing models? HIE role amidst other entities?
Most valuable operational health data use cases for patients/caregivers for efficient care navigation or provider competition?
How can CMS encourage info blocking complaints? Impact on data exchange?
Challenges/benefits of digital ID credentials for patients/caregivers? How to improve access? Role of CMS/payers/providers/apps in adoption?
How can CMS encourage providers (incl. rural) to leverage approved digital health products? Obstacles? Provider responsibilities?
Obstacles to developing/deploying/using innovative apps for physician workflows (quality, docs, billing)? Mitigation?
Importance of all EHR data formats being accessible for exchange? Challenges, impact, barriers, implications, priority?
Standard/policy changes for patient third-party apps to access administrative workflows (intake, schedules, appointments)?

Which FHIR APIs/capabilities (Patient Access, Standardized, Provider Directory, Provider Access, Payer-to-Payer, Prior Auth, Bulk FHIR, SMART, CDS Hooks) do you support/utilize? Describe model, use case, constraints.
Is TEFCA advancing provider access? Examples? Changes? Other options? Redundant standards?
How can CMS support providers in making high-quality, timely, comprehensive data available for interop? Mitigate burden? Reuse existing workflows/metrics?
Ways CMS can simplify clinical quality data responsibilities for providers? Bulk FHIR for quality submissions? Consolidate interop/quality reporting? Data registry requirements?
How to encourage providers to accept patient digital IDs instead of proprietary logins? Provider needs for transition? Balance privacy/convenience?
Challenges/benefits of digital IDs for providers? Impact on access, provider directory, data flow? Combine FHIR addresses/identity?
How can trust community members (e.g., QHINs) better support reduced burden and enhanced identity management/security?
Should ASTP/ONC revise info blocking exceptions to further EHI access/exchange and promote competition?
Most effective info blocking disincentive for provider categories currently without one?
How to encourage providers to submit info blocking complaints? Impact on data exchange?
Policy/technical limitations in TEFCA for payers? Suggested changes? Impact on participation?
How can CMS encourage payers to accelerate API implementation for patients, providers, other payers (like Blue Button 2.0, Data at Point of Care)?
How can CMS encourage payers to accept patient digital IDs instead of proprietary logins?
Value to payers of a nationwide provider directory with FHIR endpoints and digital IDs?
Ways payers can simplify provider clinical quality data responsibilities? Interest in bulk extraction for payer-side calculation? Consolidate reporting? Payer tech for real-time quality data?
How can CMS encourage payers to submit info blocking complaints? Impact?

section_title: Technology Vendors, Data Providers, and Networks

questions.summary_text: Short/long-term steps for CMS to stimulate developer interest in digital health products for Medicare beneficiaries?
Regarding CMS Data: Additional valuable data via CMS APIs? Valuable alongside Blue Button 2.0? Obstacles? Other APIs CMS/ASTP/ONC should consider?
Digital ID implementation: Challenges/benefits? Impact of requiring digital IDs on cybersecurity/exchange? Impact of OpenID Connect?
How can CMS better encourage use of open, standards-based, public APIs over proprietary?
How could a nationwide provider directory of FHIR endpoints improve access? Who publishes? User cost?
Unique interop functions of TEFCA? Existing alternatives? Redundant standards to consolidate?
Degree USCDI improved interop/exchange? Limitations? Need more elements or challenges with use? Prefer less structured for coverage?
Most effective certification criteria/standards under ONC Health IT Certification Program?
Certification: Benefits/drawbacks of prioritizing API-enabled capabilities over software functionality? Revise criteria for all chart data exchange? CMS policy for provider data quality?
Further steps for ASTP/ONC for Cures Act API condition (access all EHI without special effort)?
EHI export: Revise to specify standardized API requirements? Workflow improvements? CMS policy changes?
Should CMS endorse non-CMS data sources/networks? Criteria/metrics?
New opportunities with APIs for entire EHI? Obstacles? Tradeoffs USCDI vs full EHI?
Networks' use of FHIR APIs: Endpoints connected? Types/categories/geographies? How established? Interconnect with other networks?
Bulk FHIR APIs: How would increased use improve use cases/data flow? Disadvantages?
Tradeoffs of point-to-point vs. shared network infrastructure? Current rules encourage scalable participation? Changes for alignment?
Given operational costs, CMS/ASTP/ONC role in ensuring viability of data sharing networks (supply/demand, usage, outcomes)?
Information blocking: Examples of practices experienced? Additional policies to discourage provider info blocking? Actors lacking disincentives?
Price transparency implementation: Shortcomings? Workflows benefiting most? Valuable improvements for patients/providers/payers? Motivate solution development?
Incentives for APMs (ACOs, MSSP) to leverage digital health products? Obstacles?
How to better integrate AI, pop health analytics, risk stratification, care coordination, usability, quality measurement, patient engagement into APM requirements?
Essential health IT capabilities for VBC arrangements? Other valuable capabilities?
Essential data types for successful VBC participation?
How do current ONC cert criteria/standards support VBC delivery?
Specific HIT capabilities benefiting APMs not in current cert criteria that should be included?
How can tech requirements for APMs (CEHRT, etc.) reduce complexity while preserving flexibility?
How can other HHS policies supplement CEHRT for APM digital health use? Barriers to APMs receiving patient event notifications?
Different tech requirements for APM vs non-APM orgs (quality reporting, interop)?
CY24 PFS rule: What cert criteria for specific/general Advanced APMs under 'Base EHR' flexibility? Flexibilities for smaller/rural providers for CEHRT?
Specific interop challenges encountered in implementing VBC programs?
Tech standardization to preserve program flexibility while promoting APM tech innovation?
Improvements to existing criteria/standards to better support VBC and reduce provider burden?
How could digital ID credentials improve VBC delivery/outcomes?
How could nationwide provider directory of FHIR endpoints improve access to patient data/claims understanding? Key data elements for effectiveness?
